text:
Sawaddee ka! welcome to hot thai kitchen so 
the other day for lunch i made a version of

the famous Pad See Ew noodles but using these 
thin rice vermicelli noodles and i realized that

by the time i got up to cook to the time that i 
sat down to eat it had only been 20 minutes and

i thought wow if i had gone out to get takeout 
i might still be stuck in a line somewhere so

i thought this was a great recipe to share let's 
get started so the first thing you want to do is

soak these noodles i've got some room temp 
water here and the noodles are going in

and these are going to take anywhere between 
five to ten minutes to rehydrate depending on

the brand which is very important different 
brands have slightly different thicknesses

but i will show you how to tell when they're 
done okay so that's really going to be your

time limiting factor in terms of prep because 
there's very little else to do patsy you calls

for chinese broccoli as our classic vegetable but 
really for this just you can use whatever greens

you have in the fridge but i do like that chinese 
broccoli has crunchy stems thin bias for the stems

so it's nice and crunchy but it's not too much and 
then once you get to the thinner parts of the stem

you can go a little bit bigger with the leaf you 
just half chop like that i should tell you that

Pad See Ew in thailand ... here in north america 
Pad See Ew is usually made with the fresh wide

rice noodles but in thailand it's quite common 
to have this made with these thin noodles and

we call it Sen Mee Pad See Ew and the only 
other thing we have to chop is garlic smash

come on there we go some garlic 
is more stubborn than others

today i'm going to take care of my vegetarian 
friends and do a vegetarian version of the

sauce because we already have the regular 
non-vegetarian version of the sauce in the

other Pad See Ew recipe so if you want to 
do vegetarian equal parts thai soy sauce

and golden mountain sauce which is our other kind 
of soy sauce you can do liquid Bragg's liquid

amino, Maggi seasoning or even do like tamari or 
something like that it's just a different kind

of soy sauce to keep it interesting if you want 
to do again non-vegetarian version i'll link to

that recipe down below that's the sauce how easy 
is that there is one thing we're going to add but

i'm not going to mix into the sauce and that's 
black soy sauce and we always add that for color

you can use dark soy sauce if you want um and i'm 
gonna put it in a separate little thing because

this brand of black soy sauce is very dark and 
if i pour it from the bottle sometimes it's like

blah! and it's way too dark and it's not good so 
you want to be careful with this one some other

brands like the dragonfly brand it's very light 
so you can be more generous with that one okay

believe it or not that is all the prep because 
everything else is just eggs which you don't have

to do anything with if you're doing adding meat 
you can add any kind of meat that you want i'll

add extra information on what to do if you want to 
add meat in the written recipe as well we have so

much time left that we are going to also make the 
condiment pad see ew is sweet and salty basically

so what's recommended to serve with pad see ew is 
chili vinegar or "prik nam som" super simple you

take a chili it could be any kind a thai chili a 
jalapeno a serrano just anything with the spice

level that you like put the chilies in a bowl 
and then just cover it with vinegar when you're

ready to eat this will be ready to use there we 
go we got our condiments done we got a prep done

and we still have so much time the noodles aren't 
even done yet my god let's get our wok set up

so i want to show you what the noodles look like 
when they're not quite done so when you pick it up

it's not drooping completely like it's still 
kind of resisting gravity a little bit that's

not done yet if you're in a rush use warm water 
and it'll go like in half the time but don't do

hot water because that will overcook them very 
quickly the noodles are pretty much done and

i'll show you when i pick this up see how 
much it just droops completely it's not like

sticking out a little bit that's kind of what 
you're going for so that is now ready and good

thing about using room temp water is it does 
take a little more time but it's a lot more

forgiving you don't have to rush it so i'm just 
going to drain this and then cut them a little

just to make it easier to toss i really 
shouldn't have mixed it up before I cut it

it's not necessary and you can cut it after 
you're done but good to do it now why not okay
wok on let's get started

you do want a non-stick pan of some sort 
your wok should be well seasoned or you

use a non-stick skillet because these noodles 
tend to stick the garlic can go in right away
get that infused

garlic will infuse into the oil and the 
oil carries that flavor throughout the dish

that's why we do garlic first okay 
once the garlic starts to turn just

a little bit golden you can go in with 
the eggs you don't want the garlic to be

brown or that will get bitter 
and then scramble the eggs gently

if you see garlic at the edges you can push 
them towards the center to prevent them from
burning while you scramble the eggs
you can come in a little closer maybe yeah

there we go and you want the egg cooked completely 
before you add the noodles because what i found

is these noodles are so thin that 
if you've got liquid egg in the wok

you put the noodles in the liquid egg 
gunks up the noodles and turn them clumpy

okay not a big problem with big noodles 
but with tiny noodles that's a thing okay

my wok needs to be re-seasoned that's 
okay okay now the noodles go in

give that a quick toss get it nice and hot 
and then basically all of our sauces goes in

seasoning and also a little bit of water 
the amount of water is highly dependent

on the brand of noodles also so definitely 
something you have to start with less

and add more as you go and then once you've 
worked with a brand of noodles a couple times you
you get a good idea and at this point

you want to keep tossing until all the liquid 
has been absorbed don't forget the sugar omg

looks like a lot but pad see ew you is... 
it won't end up tasting like sweet sweet but

it does need the sugar to balance all 
the salt it's sort of like a salty sweet
combo which is what makes it so delicious
be very one of the common issues people have

with cooking these thin noodles is they end up 
breaking them into tiny pieces which is very

easy to do like i've done it many times 
and that comes from tossing it too much

and also using a spatula to like stir too much 
a metal spatula especially and then breaking

them and also overcooking them because when the 
noodles are well cooked or undercooked they're

not going to break they'll only break once they 
become soft so you have to kind of like taste

that's good a little bit more 
maybe give it a little more time
so i'm gonna add just a splash more water

this is the hard part about this 
and that is getting the water

right and then a little bit of 
our black soy sauce for that color

don't worry about incorporating 
the eggs into the noodles right now

with these noodles they are particularly hard to 
mix everything in and that's another reason why

people end up with broken noodles is they try to 
worry too much about getting everything mixed in

right now and they just over mix and then break 
the noodle okay that's done vegetables go in

oh i'm starting to smell toastiness that's 
exactly exactly what we want ah almost forgot

pepper white pepper you can add it at the end 
but i think it's better when you put it inside

you hear that toasting that's good stuff okay 
now at this point if you over cook the gailan,

chinese broccoli, they turn chewy 
so you just want to get it wilted
and then be done with it

okay i'm going to actually turn 
this off now because i know

that see how this burns stuff if that happens 
just take it out you will be rewarded with nice

smoky flavor because that happened but you 
don't necessarily want to eat it okay that

is done how easy and quick was that so camera 
has been going for 19 minutes and 48 seconds

but we haven't been cooking for that long 
less than 20 minutes what did i tell you

less than 20 minutes these are now ready to eat 
and this is bringing back memories for me because

in thailand growing up this was actually the 
kind of pad see ew that i ate the most often

because that one this one restaurant my 
family frequented they were famous for their

sen mee pad see ew and so i didn't actually 
have the fresh noodle pad see ew until later

so this is like the original pad see ew 
for me okay let's eat it smells so good

patsy you and that smoky wok flavor which you 
may not get if you use like a non-stick pan but

you can try by just letting the noodles and the 
eggs toast a bit now i know that i want prik nam

som on it because i am my mother's daughter 
and she loves prik nam som on everything

quick toss yeah you can add tofu 
you can have chicken but i find

like i'm satisfied with eggs i need 
to get a stem stem is the crunchy

oh it is such simple goodness i tell you that's 
like the word that i can use to describe it it's

it it has simple flavors in a sense that 
it's not like it doesn't have like herbs

and spices and all that stuff but it is so 
thoroughly satisfying especially considering

how quick it was to put together and you 
can absolutely use this as a side dish

this is great alongside a papaya salad 
like a lot of times thai people do that

but if you have like a chicken or a beef 
or a protein that you're having as a main

and you don't want to just do plain rice 
these noodles are perfect as a side kids

love this stuff my son loves this stuff because 
this texture is so fun and it's a really simple

sort of kid friendly flavor as well so i hope you 
enjoyed that something a little different and the

recipe as always will be on hotthaikitchen.com 
a special thanks to our patreon supporters who

help support the show and if you want to 
watch my show ad free and get bonus content

and prioritize access to me you can check out 
what patreon is all about in the description below

thank you as always for watching and i will see 
you next time for your next delicious thai meal.
